A - WING , JANPATH BHAWAN 
JANPATH, NEW DELHI -110001 
 
No. CAS-7(19)/2010/Div.I (MHA) 
 
                    Date :  5th February, 2011 
AVSEC Order No. 21 / 2011 
 
Subject :  Comprehensive review in the security arrangements at airports in India. 
 
In continuation of this Bureau AVSEC Order No.18/2011 dated   
02/02/2011 and in exercise of powers conferred by Section 5A of the Aircraft Act, 
1934, delegated to him vide Government of India, Ministry of Civil Aviation 
Notification No. 1797, dated July 3, 1997, for the purpose of securing the safety of 
aircraft operations at the civil airports in India, the Commissioner of Security (CA) 
directs that :- 
 
“Screening of passengers, staff and  visitors at the entry gates of the 
airport through DFMD/HHMD and physical frisking on random basis 
shall be carried out depending on local situations and inputs received 
from the intelligence agencies. In case of suspected baggage, additional 
measures like screening through X-BIS and ETD, may also be taken”.  
 
2. 
This order shall be implemented by all concerned with immediate effect. 
Any violation of this order shall attract penalty under Section 11A of the Aircraft 
Act, 1934. 
 
 
(Gurjot Singh Malhi, IPS) 
Commissioner of Security (CA)
